answers.answer: Try posting this in the Weight Loss Alternatives Forum.This forum is for natural dieting and exercising.

OK, Thanks :) !What is the difference between the two forums ??I thought the weight loss alternative was for people considering or have had by-pass and things like that.This isogenics system is supposed to be a "natural" cleansing approach to dieting , but I don't know :) !I just wanted to throw it out there and see if anyone has tried this diet.I will try the other forum and see if I get any more info there.Thanks....have a blessed day!

This forum is for dieting naturally, with no fasting, or supplements, etc.We concentrate on a healthy diet, which includes, whole grains, fruits, veggies, low fat or fat free dairy products, protein, complex carbs, and exercise.The Weight Loss Alternative Forum is for anything other than this.I hope you get your answer.

I think the question you ask about how one defines "natural" points out that this is a gray zone!  I don't know about Isogenics, but some forms of fasting/detoxing can be done with natural products.However, I do know that I've never met a cow that "naturally" produces FF dairy.I'm getting confused as to why this forum seems to be taking the stance of "my diet is better than yours" lately.  Instead of turning people away, why not get discussions going about good and safe ways to achieve weight loss?I'm not trying to pick a fight.  The top of the forum reads:"This patient support community is for discussions relating to dieting, alcohol and dieting, balanced menus, diabetes, success stories, exercise, metabolism, healthy dieting, healthy snacks, holiday tips, and nutrition. Also covered are discussions relating to specific diet plans like the South Beach Diet, Atkins Diet, Slim-Fast, Weight Watchers, Counting Calories, Fat Flush, Body for Life and others.""Fat Flush" is a detox diet, much like a fasting regime.  "Slim-Fast" is not a natural product.  I am getting confused by the terse dismissals being offered to people who have come here for support.I'm not interesting in picking a fight, I am only expressing my concerns about what I consider to be hostile responses appearing here.Regardless of your chosen diet, I hope you all have a good weekend.~W

I never said that my diet was better than anyone elses. What works for one, may not work for another.I was told to refer to the Weight Loss Alternative Forum when supplements, or anything of the kind were in question.Maybe both of these forums should be merged.Good point about the FF dairy.
